Detailed Description

A dummy implementation for example purposes. Just barely enough is implemented to allow the parser to run. Merely returns the input expression without evaluating it.

Function Documentation

Cell* eval ( Cell *const   c  ) 

Evaluate the expression tree whose root is pointed to by c (error if c does not hold a well-formed expression).

Parameters:
c A constant pointer to a Cell instance, which is the root of the tree to be computed. Root of tree must not be nil, or error occurs.
Returns:
A pointer to the Cell containing the final answer. This Cell is always a temporary Cell that should be disposed of whenever it's no longer needed.

template<typename T>
void safe_delete ( T &  c  ) 

A helper function for safely delete.

Parameters:
c Reference to the pointer to be deleted. T should be a pointer type

Variable Documentation

map<string, Cell*> definition_map

The map container used by eval to support define.
